abstract: Warren E. Buffett announced on Monday that Douglas Kass, a hedge fund manager, would be added to the panel of analysts who question him and Berkshire’s vice chairman, Charles T. Munger, on stage during Berkshire Hathaway’s annual gathering in Omaha on May 4.
snippet: Warren E. Buffett announced on Monday that Douglas Kass, a hedge fund manager, would be added to the panel of analysts who question him and Berkshire’s vice chairman, Charles T. Munger, on stage during Berkshire Hathaway’s annual gathering in Omah...
lead_paragraph: Warren E. Buffett has found his bear.

headline.main: Buffett Picks His ‘Bear’ for Annual Meeting
headline.print_headline: Buffett Picks His Bear for His Annual Meeting

abstract: Berkshire Hathaway’s performance over the last four years has been disappointing. That’s likely to increase the chances of a cash payout, whether from Mr. Buffett or his successor, the author writes.
snippet: Berkshire Hathaway’s performance over the last four years has been disappointing. That’s likely to increase the chances of a cash payout, whether from Mr. Buffett or his successor, the author writes.
lead_paragraph: Warren E. Buffett’s stance against paying Berkshire Hathaway shareholders a dividend looks to be wearing thin.

headline.main: Restless Shareholders May Force Buffett’s Hand on Dividends
